1550390758_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body: Default site limit 10MB, and you tried to upload 60MB video as non optional file, so every client should download it right away. It's better way to put it to other folder, like "media/" as you see in content.json.

> [leftside](#comment_611_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Oh I see.How can I keep that 60MB file as a non-optional file without any problem?

You can increase your site size, but after it won't be download by default (clients would be asking to update limit), that's not good solution.

So I think much better way is to put it to ZeroUp (or your clone of it) and put the link into your blog.

> [leftside](#comment_612_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): Thanks for ur kind comment. How can i increase my site size?

Just add folder with big files as optional:
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/#optional

> [leftside](#comment_613_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): I mean, how to put large file in the site subdirectory without granting its directory optional.

Try to update size limit first (drag zero icon in right-upper corner and set Size limit to 100 MB for example).
